recipe.name: Quick Taco Soup with Pork Carnitas
recipe.description: Enchiladas in a bowl! A thick, chunky soup on the table in 15 minutes with amazing flavours. This recipe is part of my Pork Carnitas series so is made using Pork Carnitas (Mexican Pulled Pork) but you can also make this with shredded chicken. By using pre cooked meat this is a super fast meal you can get on the table in 15 minutes!
recipeIngredient: 2 cups shredded Mexican pulled pork ((Pork Carnitas) (or shredded chicken))
24 oz / 680 g   tomato puree passata ((or crushed tomatoes - see Note 1))
4 cups (1 litre / 2 pints)   chicken or vegetable broth / stock

recipeInstructions.text: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over high heat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat the oil in a large saucepan over high heat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the pulled pork and cook for 1 minute until parts of it are browned, then remove from the saucepan. Do this step even if you are using shredded chicken or another meat.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the pulled pork and cook for 1 minute until parts of it are browned, then remove from the saucepan. Do this step even if you are using shredded chicken or another meat.

recipeInstructions.text: Add garlic and onion, sauté until onion becomes translucent (2 minutes), then add the capsicum (bell pepper) and cook for 1 minute until softened.
recipeInstructions.name: Add garlic and onion, sauté until onion becomes translucent (2 minutes), then add the capsicum (bell pepper) and cook for 1 minute until softened.

recipeInstructions.text: Return the pulled pork into the saucepan and add all other ingredients except salt and pepper. If you are making this ahead to FREEZE, see below for instructions.
recipeInstructions.name: Return the pulled pork into the saucepan and add all other ingredients except salt and pepper. If you are making this ahead to FREEZE, see below for instructions.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir to scrap the brown bits from the pulled pork off the bottom of the pan to mix in with the soup flavours.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir to scrap the brown bits from the pulled pork off the bottom of the pan to mix in with the soup flavours.

recipeInstructions.text: Bring to boil then turn down heat slightly and allow to simmer rapidly for 3 minutes so the flavours can come together. If you are using crushed tinned tomatoes instead of passata, let it simmer for a further 5 minutes to let the tomatoes breakdown a bit. If the soup gets too thick to your liking, just add a bit more water.
recipeInstructions.name: Bring to boil then turn down heat slightly and allow to simmer rapidly for 3 minutes so the flavours can come together. If you are using crushed tinned tomatoes instead of passata, let it simmer for a further 5 minutes to let the tomatoes breakdown a bit. If the soup gets too thick to your liking, just add a bit more water.

recipeInstructions.text: Do a taste test, then season with salt and pepper. It is important to season last because different stock brands have different levels of saltiness.
recipeInstructions.name: Do a taste test, then season with salt and pepper. It is important to season last because different stock brands have different levels of saltiness.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve with toppings of choice. The more toppings = more delicious!
recipeInstructions.name: Serve with toppings of choice. The more toppings = more delicious!

itemListElement.text: In step 4, do not add the tomato passata or chicken/vegetable stock/broth. Instead, add 1 cup of water, bring to simmer and stir, scraping the bottom of the pot to get the brown bits off.
itemListElement.name: In step 4, do not add the tomato passata or chicken/vegetable stock/broth. Instead, add 1 cup of water, bring to simmer and stir, scraping the bottom of the pot to get the brown bits off.

itemListElement.text: Remove pot from heat and set aside to cool, then pour the contents into a container or ziplock bag and freeze.
itemListElement.name: Remove pot from heat and set aside to cool, then pour the contents into a container or ziplock bag and freeze.

itemListElement.text: To cook, defrost, then pour the contents into a saucepan. Add the tomato passata and chicken stock/broth. Then follow steps 6 onwards as per above.
itemListElement.name: To cook, defrost, then pour the contents into a saucepan. Add the tomato passata and chicken stock/broth. Then follow steps 6 onwards as per above.

review.reviewBody: I used ground chicken since I didn't have time for pork carnitas. But still very tasty. Scratched my itch for taco flavor.
I always have juice leftover so I started replacing some of the water with the juice. It's amazing in the quick taco soup.
Super tasty! Great use of leftover pork carnitas
This is delicious and so simple. Had some leftover pulled pork in the freezer - made it exactly as you said and it came out perfect.

I made this and it was delicious! Just a few modifications.  I used smoked pulled pork made on the grill. I had frozen roasted/pureed tomatillos. I replaced the tomatoes with the tomatillos. I added a bit more chili powder and cumin than the recipe. Topped with avocado and cilantro.  It was the Verde version!

I made this the other day and holy damn it was delicious!! :D I put some canned corn in too and mixed the beans in a food processor since I can't stand the texture of it xD And it worked splendid and both me and my boyfriend loved it! This is a new staple recipe in our home now, so thank you so much for sharing :D
You are very wise - of course it is!!!  Off to shred my pork.  Yum - love this recipe and now keen to make the soup xx
